item.title: A Call to Chapel with Rev. Eboni Marshall Turman, Ph.D. at Cramton Auditorium
item.description:
Sun, 01 Feb 2026

The Reverend Eboni Marshall Turman, Ph.D. is the associate professor of theology, African American religion, and African American studies at Yale University Divinity School in New Haven, CT. A first-career concert dancer and ordained National Baptist preacher, her research interests span the varieties of twentieth and twenty-first century US theological liberalisms, most especially Black and womanist theological, social ethical, and theo-aesthetic traditions.

An uncompromising race woman of faith, she co-chairs the Black Theology unit of the American Academy of Religion, is a founding member of the Black Church Collective, Brooklyn, NY, for which she served as lead author of “On Black Lives Matter: A Theological Statement from the Black Churches,” a viral missive that mobilized over one thousand Black pastors throughout the United States and documented the moral standpoint of the prophetic Black Churches in response to the January 6th Insurrection, and formerly served on the executive committee of the Society for the Study of Black Religion.

To learn more about our guest speaker, click here.

View on site | Email this event

item.title: Research Month Call for Abstracts at Blackburn Center (Armour J. Blackburn University Center)
item.description:
Sun, 01 Feb 2026

We are pleased to invite you to participate in Howard University Research Month 2026 by submitting your research abstract for the Annual Research Symposium, the premier showcase of scholarly and creative work across our campus community!

This year’s Research Symposium will take place April 30 – May 1, 2026, at the Armour J. Blackburn Center, featuring both oral and poster presentations across a wide range of disciplines including Biological & Biomedical Sciences, Physical Sciences & Engineering, Humanities, Social Sciences, Environmental Studies, Business, Creative Arts & Design, Education & Outreach, and Translational & Clinical Sciences.

All abstracts must be submitted electronically by 11:59 p.m. on Sunday, February 15, 2026.

Submitting an abstract is a wonderful opportunity to highlight your research, engage with peers and mentors, and contribute to the vibrant intellectual community at Howard University. Whether you are an undergraduate, graduate student, postdoctoral scholar, faculty member, or staff researcher, we encourage you to share your work and be part of this dynamic celebration of discovery! Howard University Research Month

Submit your abstract and find more details at: https://researchmonth.howard.edu/

View on site | Email this event

item.title: Howard AI Chats: AI Policy Listening Session
item.description:
Wed, 04 Feb 2026

You’re invited to join Howard AI Chats: AI Policy Listening Session, an interactive, virtual conversation where you’ll learn from colleagues across Howard and share how AI is showing up in your own role. This session is designed to surface real experiences, insights, and questions that will inform upcoming AI guidance and resources at Howard. We hope you’ll join us for this important and engaging conversation!

Sponsored by the Howard AI Advisory Council

Details

Date: February 4, 2026

Time: 12:00–1:30 PM

Format: Virtual and interactive

Register (required): https://howard.zoom.us/meeting/register/kI-jhC5yTimUAS0KBI6NtA

The session will include facilitated small-group breakout discussions. No preparation is needed; just bring your perspective and curiosity!

View on site | Email this event
